item.title: Report E-2023100755
item.description:
Report E-2023100755

Identified by scraper @ 2023-10-30T15:12:59+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-12
  • City: WILMINGTON
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On October 12, 2023, one (1) 5-gallon pail of printing ink was punctured by a forklift and released approximately five (5) gallons of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Thin Line Environmental (TLE) to remediate the impacted site. TLE personnel collected one (1) damaged 5-gallon pail of UN1210 and containerized it in one (1) 55-gallon drum. Crews deployed granular absorbents and worked them in using hand tools. Once collected, TLE personnel utilized absorbent wipes to remove any residual product. All UN1210 impacted material was collected and containerized in one (1) 55-gallon drum and RLC personnel took possession of the waste.

item.title: Report E-2023100707
item.description:
Report E-2023100707

Identified by scraper @ 2023-10-27T18:13:30+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-11
  • City: WILMINGTON
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On October 11, 2023, three (3) 48-pound boxes of UN3262 were damaged by a forklift and released approximately ten (10) pounds of product to the loading dock floor and pallets. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Thin Line Environmental (TLE) to remediate the impacted site. Crews utilized a HEPA filter drum vacuum to remove the free-standing product from the impacted area. Cleaners and absorbent pads were utilized to remove any residual product. The damaged boxes and all UN3262 impacted materials and spent absorbents were collected and containerized into one (1) 95-gallon drum for disposal purposes. The undamaged cargo was wiped down and repalletized for continued processing and shipping.

item.title: Report X-2023100214
item.description:
Report X-2023100214

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-01T18:13:50+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-22
  • City: GROVE CITY
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: 1. X-2023100214 SequenceEvent: The package was taken out of system flow due to noted spillage, upon inspection of inner contents the caps on all of the containers were loose causing spillage. DescribePack: Loose caps. DurationRel: 0 and MitigateEffect: The damaged package and contents were placed in a lined hazmat tote to mitigate spillage. 2. X-2023100355 SequenceEvent: The package was taken out of system flow due to noted spillage, upon inspection of inner contents, the caps on the containers were loose causing spillage. DescribePack: Loose caps. DurationRel: 0 and MitigateEffect: The damaged package and contents were placed in a lined hazmat tote to mitigate spillage.

  • Description: During off loading it was discovered that the load had shifted during transit and that the one 1050 pound large forklift battery (un2794) had been damaged by a sharp object and had released 0.5 gallons of acid. The warehouse crew was able to contain and cleanup the release, so no contractors were dispatched.
